body:
<!--e57a25ab6845829454e8d69fc972939a-->

The following sections might be updated with supplementary metadata relevant to reviewers and maintainers.

<!--174a7506f384e20aa4161008e828411d-->
### Conflicts
Reviewers, this pull request conflicts with the following ones:

* [#15262](https://drahtbot.github.io/bitcoin_core_issue_redirect/r/15262.html) (build: Enable C++14 in build, require C++14 compiler. by practicalswift)

If you consider this pull request important, please also help to review the conflicting pull requests. Ideally, start with the one that should be merged first.
I was under the impression that the minimum would bump?
Yep I'm down for either, just putting this forward as an option.

Not clear why the build is failing - the reported test seems to pass:
```
2/113 - feature_maxuploadtarget.py failed, Duration: 59 s
stdout:
2018-12-31T10:43:50.480000Z TestFramework (INFO): Initializing test directory /tmp/test_runner_₿_🏃_20181231_104336/feature_maxuploadtarget_108
2018-12-31T10:44:06.536000Z TestFramework (INFO): Peer 0 disconnected after downloading old block too many times
2018-12-31T10:44:47.537000Z TestFramework (INFO): Peer 1 able to repeatedly download new block
2018-12-31T10:44:47.640000Z TestFramework (INFO): Peer 1 disconnected after trying to download old block
2018-12-31T10:44:47.640000Z TestFramework (INFO): Advancing system time on node to clear counters...
2018-12-31T10:44:47.742000Z TestFramework (INFO): Peer 2 able to download old block
2018-12-31T10:44:47.743000Z TestFramework (INFO): Restarting nodes with -whitelist=127.0.0.1
2018-12-31T10:44:49.319000Z TestFramework (INFO): Peer still connected after trying to download old block (whitelisted)
2018-12-31T10:44:49.373000Z TestFramework (INFO): Stopping nodes
2018-12-31T10:44:49.525000Z TestFramework (INFO): Cleaning up /tmp/test_runner_₿_🏃_20181231_104336/feature_maxuploadtarget_108 on exit
2018-12-31T10:44:49.525000Z TestFramework (INFO): Tests successful
stderr:
Exception ignored in: 
TEST                                  | STATUS    | DURATION
wallet_hd.py                          | ✓ Passed  | 7 s
feature_maxuploadtarget.py            | ✖ Failed  | 59 s
```
https://travis-ci.org/bitcoin/bitcoin/jobs/473717379#L2731
It fails because the stderr is not empty

> It fails because the stderr is not empty

~Thanks, that prompted this: #15076~

Thanks, overlooked that output.
~Travis has not been running against this PR as of today. Pinged Github to raise the issue.~
Needs rebase
Closing because we're finally green and a clean PR would be nice.

diff_hunk:
@@ -102,6 +102,16 @@ jobs:
         FUNCTIONAL_TESTS_CONFIG="--exclude feature_block.py,p2p_invalid_messages.py"
         GOAL="install"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --disable-wallet --with-gui=qt5 CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --with-sanitizers=thread --disable-hardening --disable-asm CC=clang CXX=clang++"
+# x86_64 Linux (trusty, no depends, only system libs)
+    - stage: test
+      env: >-
+        HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
+        DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:14.04
+        PACKAGES="clang llvm python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools libssl-dev libevent-dev bsdmainutils libboost-system-dev libboost-filesystem-dev libboost-chrono-dev libboost-test-dev libboost-thread-dev libdb5.3++-dev libminiupnpc-dev libzmq3-dev libprotobuf-dev protobuf-compiler libqrencode-dev"
+        NO_DEPENDS=1
+        RUN_FUNCTIONAL_TESTS=false # Disabled for now. TODO identify suppressions or exclude specific tests
+        GOAL="install"
+        BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-incompatible-bdb --with-gui=qt5 CC=clang CXX=clang++"
body: gcc should be sufficient so we save ourself from another round of clang workarounds?

diff_hunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,15 @@ jobs:
         NO_DEPENDS=1
         GOAL="install"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --disable-wallet --with-gui=qt5 CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --with-sanitizers=thread --disable-hardening --disable-asm CC=clang CXX=clang++"
+# x86_64 Linux (trusty, no depends, only system libs)
+    - stage: test
+      env: >-
+        HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
+        DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:14.04
+        PACKAGES="libglib2.0-dev libicu-dev libpng-dev python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools protobuf-compiler libdbus-1-dev libharfbuzz-dev libprotobuf-dev"
+        DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1 ALLOW_HOST_PACKAGES=1"
body: This should say `NO_DEPENDS=1` and we should use the boost libs from ubuntu (E.g. https://packages.ubuntu.com/trusty/libboost-thread-dev)?

diff_hunk:
@@ -101,6 +101,15 @@ jobs:
         NO_DEPENDS=1
         GOAL="install"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --disable-wallet --with-gui=qt5 CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --with-sanitizers=thread --disable-hardening --disable-asm CC=clang CXX=clang++"
+# x86_64 Linux (trusty, no depends, only system libs)
+    - stage: test
+      env: >-
+        HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
+        DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:14.04
+        PACKAGES="libglib2.0-dev libicu-dev libpng-dev python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools protobuf-compiler libdbus-1-dev libharfbuzz-dev libprotobuf-dev"
+        DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1 ALLOW_HOST_PACKAGES=1"
+        GOAL="install"
+        BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-gui=qt5 --enable-glibc-back-compat --enable-reduce-exports --enable-debug CXXFLAGS=\"-g0 -O2\""
body: Could use `--with-gui=no` for now and only fix the code (in a separate pull) when we decide to support 5.2 (as opposed to 5.4/5.5)?

         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --disable-wallet --with-gui=qt5 CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --with-sanitizers=thread --disable-hardening --disable-asm CC=clang CXX=clang++"
+# x86_64 Linux (trusty, no depends, only system libs)
+    - stage: test
+      env: >-
+        HOST=x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu
+        DOCKER_NAME_TAG=ubuntu:14.04
+        PACKAGES="libglib2.0-dev libicu-dev libpng-dev python3-zmq qtbase5-dev qttools5-dev-tools protobuf-compiler libdbus-1-dev libharfbuzz-dev libprotobuf-dev"
+        DEP_OPTS="NO_QT=1 NO_UPNP=1 DEBUG=1 ALLOW_HOST_PACKAGES=1"

+        BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --with-gui=qt5 --enable-glibc-back-compat --enable-reduce-exports --enable-debug CXXFLAGS=\"-g0 -O2\""
body: 5.2 is listed as the minimum required version here: https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/master/doc/dependencies.md

diff_hunk:
@@ -499,7 +499,10 @@ def get_next(self):
                     log_out.seek(0), log_err.seek(0)
                     [stdout, stderr] = [log_file.read().decode('utf-8') for log_file in (log_out, log_err)]
                     log_out.close(), log_err.close()
-                    if proc.returncode == TEST_EXIT_PASSED and stderr == "":
+                    # Ignore "Exception ignored in: " stderr messages
+                    # produce by python <3.6 cleanup (ubuntu < 16.04)
body: Nit: this only exists in python 3.4

diff_hunk:
@@ -109,6 +109,16 @@ jobs:
         GOAL="install"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --disable-wallet --with-gui=qt5 CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --with-sanitizers=thread --disable-hardening --disable-asm CC=clang CXX=clang++"
 
+    - stage: test
+      name: ''x86_64 Linux  [GOAL: install]  [trusty]  [no depends, only system libs]''
body: Looks like extra quotes around the name.

diff_hunk:
@@ -499,7 +499,10 @@ def get_next(self):
                     log_out.seek(0), log_err.seek(0)
                     [stdout, stderr] = [log_file.read().decode('utf-8') for log_file in (log_out, log_err)]
                     log_out.close(), log_err.close()
-                    if proc.returncode == TEST_EXIT_PASSED and stderr == "":
+                    # Ignore "Exception ignored in: " stderr messages
+                    # produce by python <3.6 cleanup (ubuntu < 16.04)
body: What I meant to say is to mention this only exists in python 3.4, so that we can remove it when python 3.4 support is dropped.

diff_hunk:
@@ -109,6 +109,16 @@ jobs:
         GOAL="install"
         BITCOIN_CONFIG="--enable-zmq --disable-wallet --with-gui=qt5 CPPFLAGS=-DDEBUG_LOCKORDER --with-sanitizers=thread --disable-hardening --disable-asm CC=clang CXX=clang++"

body: Ah yeah, thanks.

diff_hunk:
@@ -3834,7 +3834,7 @@ CBlockIndex * CChainState::InsertBlockIndex(const uint256& hash)
 
 bool CChainState::LoadBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensus_params, CBlockTreeDB& blocktree)
 {
-    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) { return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
+    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) { AssertLockHeld(cs_main); return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
body: I think even if it compiles, the compiler couldn't enforce the lock annotations for lambdas anyway, since they could be used across compilation units?

diff_hunk:
@@ -3834,7 +3834,7 @@ CBlockIndex * CChainState::InsertBlockIndex(const uint256& hash)
 
 bool CChainState::LoadBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensus_params, CBlockTreeDB& blocktree)
 {
-    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) { return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
+    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) { AssertLockHeld(cs_main); return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
body: I'm not sure the implication, but I think this is good - `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main)` is also enforced via the `CChainState::LoadBlockIndex` declaration, and `AssertLockHeld` looks into `g_lockstack`, which is built up in the usual way. We could perhaps do without `AssertLockHeld` given the `LoadBlockIndex` declaration. Thoughts?

diff_hunk:
@@ -3834,7 +3834,7 @@ CBlockIndex * CChainState::InsertBlockIndex(const uint256& hash)
 
 bool CChainState::LoadBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensus_params, CBlockTreeDB& blocktree)
 {
-    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) { return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
+    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) { AssertLockHeld(cs_main); return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
body: Removing as it's also asserted in `InsertBlockIndex`

diff_hunk:
@@ -3834,7 +3834,7 @@ CBlockIndex * CChainState::InsertBlockIndex(const uint256& hash)
 
 bool CChainState::LoadBlockIndex(const Consensus::Params& consensus_params, CBlockTreeDB& blocktree)
 {
-    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED(cs_main) { return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
+    if (!blocktree.LoadBlockIndexGuts(consensus_params, [this](const uint256& hash) { AssertLockHeld(cs_main); return this->InsertBlockIndex(hash); }))
body: Scratch that, a thread-safety-warning is issued absent this assert, thanks to the `EXCLUSIVE_LOCKS_REQUIRED` on `InsertBlockIndex`.
